title: What is Apple TV? Apple's set-top box rumoured to get Siri this week: whistle when you can't find the remote
text:
Apple 's much-hyped event this week on September 9 is widely expected to revolve around two brand new versions of the iPhone.
However, alongside the iPhone 6s and iPhone 6s Plus, Apple is also believed to be showcasing a new version of its set-top box.
What is Apple TV? The Apple TV is a small, black box a bit larger than a hockey puck that plugs into your telly.
It comes with its own remote and lets you access services like Netflix or BBC iPlayer through your TV, effectively turning it into a smart TV.
Apple TV is a sleek set-top box with a stylish silver remote control
Apple first introduced Apple TV in 2007, and the last upgrade came two years ago.
In the meantime, other technology giants like Google, Amazon and Roku have brought out similar products that threaten to leave Apple behind.
But according to reports posted online, the world's most valuable tech company is planning a timely upgrade of its black box that will surely end up on any Apple fan's Christmas list.
What's in the new version? The biggest change is that Apple is reported to be putting Siri (the "digital assistant" from the iPhone) into Apple TV .
The new Apple TV could include Siri - letting you search channels by speaking
That would mean that rather than use a remote to find your TV show, you could use your voice and dictate commands to it.
This isn't new technology - Microsoft offers a similar feature with its Xbox One games console.
Other big updates include the introduction of an Apple TV app store, allowing third-party apps and games to be used on the gadget.
You may use an iPhone, but were you aware of the Apple TV?
In fact, games are rumoured to be a big part of the new Apple TV - it will let you play inexpensive app-style games on your TV using the remote, rather than splash out on an expensive games console like the PlayStation 4 .
While Apple hasn't gone so far as to create its own channel or streaming service, the recent reveal of Apple Music and the Beats One radio station suggest it could be a possibility.
